description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3udgf","text":"TOMAHAQ-based targeted proteomics relies on heavy-labeled reference peptides for multi-plexed quantification of peptides of interest within a set of samples. The APP amyloid precursor protein is thought to be proteolytically processed within the endolysosomal system by β-secretase and ϒ-secretase to yield various forms of Aβ. To quantitatively track APP products, we describe a protocol for design and generation of synthetic reference peptides for TOMAHAQ analysis. We also include reference peptides for the extracellular and cytosolic domains.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7E0703971FA311ECB7470A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7E0703F41FA311ECB7470A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a4bh8","text":"Design APP peptides corresponding to extracellular and cytosolic regions based on data available in Peptide Atlas which are predicted to have favorable LC-MS properties. See attached Table.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"boku9","text":"Design half-tryptic peptides based on the cleavage sites for BACE1 and ϒ-secretase. See attached table.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31hja","text":"Order commercial synthesis of peptides from Biomatik and Thermo Fischer Scientific, or similar. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cd1gt","text":"Reconstitute the peptides with 3% acetonitrile/0.1% formic acid, and quantify the concentration using Pierce Quantitative Fluorometric Peptide Assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dmm7d","text":"Mix 10 μL of 200 μM peptide in 200 mM EPPS buffer (pH 8.5) with 1 μL of 5 μg/μL super-heavy TMT reagent (TMTsh). Incubate at 25 °C for 1 hr then check the labeling efficiency by LC-MS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3habn","text":"Add extra TMTsh to under-labeled peptides until \u003e 95% labeling on both N-terminus and lysine residues is reached.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9mmqk","text":"Resuspend the peptides in 5% acetonitrile/8% formic acid, and pool the peptides.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Design and preparation of synthetic reference peptides for APP/Aβ TOMAHAQ proteomics
